prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We need to resolve the lensing structure which is typically at ~0.5-2" scales. This drives the baseline requirement for angular resolution. We also need to detect the diffuse lensing structure, which drives the requirement for depth.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The South Pole Telescope (SPT) has completed a 2500 square degree survey of the southern sky at mm wavelengths. We have constructed a catalog of ~100 strongly lensed high redshift dusty star forming galaxies (DSFGs), selected at 1.4 mm and complete with APEX/LABOCA and Herschel/SPIRE followup. With ALMA and this sample of strongly lensed galaxies we aim to: a) definitively measure the redshift distribution of DSFGs; b) study the interstellar medium in starburst galaxies with unprecedented sensitivity and spatial resolution across cosmic time; and c) probe the sub-structure of dark matter halos in the foreground lenses. To achieve these scientific goals we need redshifts and high resolution imaging for our entire sample, and we have already made great headway since the commissioning of ALMA. Here we ask for high resolution (0.25") 350 GHz continuum imaging of 43 SPT sources, for 2 minutes of integration each, for a total request of 5.7 hours. These observations will allow us to accurately pinpoint the source of the submm emission, construct accurate lens models, derive the intrinsic properties of the lensed DSFGs, and select the most exciting sources for future followup with ALMA.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
